result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark W. Krueger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:01 am - 15CF2 & 15CF20 - Defendant Mark W. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. Parties have received and reviewed information and waive reading. DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 in 15CF2.   Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 in 15CF2 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 2 in 15CF2 and dismisses and reads in 15CF20.  Submit DNA sample. Court advises DE of voting rights and prohibitions of possessing firearms.  Appeal rights given. Adj. 11:22 am. 

Court imposes:
15CF2 (Ct. 1): Sentence withheld - 3 years probation. Conditions: 6 month jail term, with huber privileges, to commence by 5:00 pm today; $2702 fine; $250 DNAAS; $65.50 BDF; $65 SBDA; AODA; 36 mo DL Rev; 36 mo IID

11:00 am - 15CF2 & 15CF20 - Defendant Mark W. Krueger appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Request by Atty. Lex to adjourn. So ordered. Bond to continue. Adj. 11:01 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark W. Krueger
Current: N8280 Hilly Haven, Phillips, WI 54555 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2015)
Prior: W10196 County Road W, Phillips, WI 54555

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE shall not consume any alcohol.

Defendant Mark W. Krueger appeared with attorney James R. Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
